path: artifacts/EasyPool Smart Contract Security Audit v2 - CoinFabrik Blog.pdf

project_path.easypool: contracts/EasyPool Smart Contract Security Audit v2 - CoinFabrik Blog/easypool

findings.title: Lack of usage of 'lockPresale' boolean
findings.description: The pool has two fields: presaleAddress and lockPresale. However, the lockPresale boolean isnâ€™t set or used for making checks.

findings.title: The state of the pool is not explicitly initialized
findings.description: When calling the init function, the pool's state is never explicitly initialized.

findings.title: Warnings on compilation
findings.description: The contracts emit warnings when compiled.

findings.title: Inconsistent usage of SafeMath
findings.description: There's not enough usage of SafeMath in some lines in QuotaLib.sol.

findings.title: Not enough documentation
findings.description: In the QuotaLib.sol contract, there's not enough documentation.

findings.title: Non declarative function naming
findings.description: Functions have poor names that don't reflect what they actually do.

findings.title: Old compiler pragmas
findings.description: The contracts use old compiler pragma directives.

findings.title: Missing deployment scripts
findings.description: Deployment scripts are missing for the contracts.

findings.title: HasNoEther was removed from OpenZeppelin
findings.description: Contracts CMService, PoolFactory, and PoolRegistry inherit from HasNoEther, which is removed from OpenZeppelin.
